Genetic predispositions that reduce the constant supply of energy to neurons ultimately disrupt the functioning of brain circuits. Mitochondrial impairments can confer increased neuronal vulnerability to oxidative, nitro-oxidative stress, and metal ions
24, 32, 39, 55, 58, 67, 68, 74 . The high metabolic demand of substantia nigra neurons might explain their selective degeneration
211 .
